## ~/repos/github/g0t4/private-auto-edit-suggests/auto_edit/new_silence/player.py:51-141
class SegmentPlotter:

    def __init__(
        self,
        analysis: AudioAnalysisResult,
        segments: list[DetectedSegment] | None = None,
        title_addon: str | None = None,
    ):
        self.analysis = analysis
        self.segments = segments or analysis.segments
        self.fig, self.ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(20, 10))
        self.title_addon = title_addon or ""
        self._setup_plot()
        self._connect_events()

    def _play_segment(self, start: float, end: float) -> None:
        sr = self.analysis.sample_rate
        audio = self.analysis.audio_samples
        start_idx = int(start * sr)
        end_idx = int(end * sr)
        segment = audio[start_idx:end_idx]
        sd.play(segment, sr)

    def _setup_plot(self) -> None:
        for seg in self.segments:
            times = np.linspace(seg.start, seg.end, len(seg.rms_segment))
            if len(seg.rms_segment) == 1:
                self.ax.scatter(
                    times,
                    seg.rms_segment,
                    color=seg.plot_color(),
                    label=seg.get_plot_message(),
                )
            else:
                self.ax.plot(
                    times,
                    seg.rms_segment,
                    color=seg.plot_color(),
                    label=seg.get_plot_message(),
                )

        self.ax.set_xlabel("Time (s)")
        self.ax.set_ylabel("Amplitude")
        self.ax.set_title(f"RMS Segments {self.title_addon}")

    def _on_click(self, event) -> None:
        if event.inaxes != self.ax:
            return
        click_time = event.xdata
        for seg in self.segments:
            if seg.start <= click_time <= seg.end:
                self._play_segment(seg.start, seg.end)
                break

    def _connect_events(self) -> None:
        setup_events(self.fig, self.ax, self._on_click)

    def show(self) -> None:
        plt.ion()  # else won't show new plots after initial call to plt.show()
        plt.show()

    def add_segments(self, new_segments: list[DetectedSegment]) -> None:
        self.segments.extend(new_segments)
        for seg in new_segments:
            times = np.linspace(seg.start, seg.end, len(seg.rms_segment))
            self.ax.plot(times, seg.rms_segment, color=seg.plot_color())
        # self.fig.canvas.draw()
        # self.fig.canvas.flush_events()

    @staticmethod
    def plot_segment(segment: DetectedSegment) -> None:
        """Display a plot of the RMS values for a single DetectedSegment."""
        # Extract RMS data and time axis
        rms = segment.rms_segment
        if rms.ndim != 1:
            rms = rms.squeeze()
        fps = 30  # assumed frame rate for time conversion
        hop_len = RMS_HOP_LENGTH
        frame_len = RMS_FRAME_LENGTH
        # Compute time per sample based on hop length
        times = np.arange(len(rms)) * hop_len / fps
        # Create the plot
        plt.figure(figsize=(8, 3))
        plt.plot(times, rms, label=f"Segment {segment.id} ({segment.label.value})")
        plt.xlabel("Time (seconds)")
        plt.ylabel("RMS")
        plt.title(f"RMS Plot for Segment {segment.id}")
        plt.legend()
        plt.grid(True)
        plt.tight_layout()
        plt.show()

from more_itertools import windowed
from operator import attrgetter
from dataclasses import dataclass
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
import rich
import sounddevice as sd
import time

what_file = gptoss_fim_video.minute1

# %%

title_addon = f"rms(frame_len={RMS_FRAME_LENGTH},hop_len={RMS_HOP_LENGTH},medfilt={USE_MEDFILT_SMOOTHING})"

analysis = full_analysis(what_file)

rich.print(analysis.merged[0:10])

# %%

def grouped(segments):

    @dataclass(frozen=True)
    class SegmentGroup:
        is_speech: bool
        segments: list[DetectedSegment]

    # return GAP(1+ segments), SPEECH(1 segment), GAP(segs), SPEECH(seg), â€¦
    for is_speech, segments in groupby(segments, key=lambda seg: seg.label == SegmentLabel.SPEECH):
        yield SegmentGroup(is_speech=is_speech, segments=list(segments))

@dataclass(frozen=True)
class NonSpeechGap:
    segments: list[DetectedSegment]

@dataclass(frozen=True)
class GapWindow:
    left_speech: DetectedSegment | None
    gap: NonSpeechGap
    right_speech: DetectedSegment | None

def build_gap_decisions(segments: list[DetectedSegment]):

    # TODO tests of:
    # - start is silence (common)
    # - start is speech (rare but possible)
    # - end is silence (common)
    # - end is speech (also rare)

    def gap(window):

        left_speech = None
        if window[0] and window[0].is_speech:
            left_speech = window[0].segments[0]
            assert len(window[0].segments) == 1, "Expected only one left speech segment"

        right_speech = None
        if window[2] and window[2].is_speech:
            right_speech = window[2].segments[0]
            assert len(window[2].segments) == 1, "Expected only one right speech segment"

        return GapWindow(
            left_speech=left_speech,
            gap=NonSpeechGap(segments=window[1].segments),
            right_speech=right_speech,
        )


    windows = [
        gap(w) for w in windowed(grouped(segments), 3) \
            if w[1] and not w[1].is_speech
    ]

    return windows

# list(_as_blocks(analysis.merged))
windows = build_gap_decisions(analysis.merged)
rich.print(list(windows))
first = windows[0]
SegmentPlotter.plot_segment(<|fim_middle|>)

# %% frame rounding around speech segments
# FYI not sure you can even discern this w/o first finding an issue in FCPX and testing it here
def play_samples(start_sample, end_sample):
    samples = analysis.audio_samples[start_sample:end_sample]

    print(f"playing samples={start_sample}-{end_sample}")
    sd.play(samples, analysis.sample_rate)
    sd.wait()

VIDEO_FPS = 30  # HARDCODED

def play_frames(start_frame, end_frame):
    start_sample = int(start_frame / VIDEO_FPS * analysis.sample_rate)
    end_sample = int(end_frame / VIDEO_FPS * analysis.sample_rate)
    play_samples(start_sample, end_sample)

def play_to_frame(analysis: AudioAnalysisResult, segment: DetectedSegment) -> None:

    print(f'{segment=}')
    start_seconds = segment.start
    end_seconds = segment.end

    # * play literal audio samples without any frame rounding

    start_sample = int(start_seconds * analysis.sample_rate)
    end_sample = int(end_seconds * analysis.sample_rate)
    play_samples(start_sample, end_sample)
    time.sleep(1)

    start_frame = start_seconds * VIDEO_FPS
    start_frame_before = math.floor(start_frame)
    start_frame_after = math.ceil(start_frame)
    rich.print(f"{start_frame_before=}, {start_frame=}, {start_frame_after=}")

    end_frame = end_seconds * VIDEO_FPS
    end_frame_before = math.floor(end_frame)
    end_frame_after = math.ceil(end_frame)
    rich.print(f"{end_frame_before=}, {end_frame=}, {end_frame_after=}")

    # does start frame matter? before/after => BOTH SOUND GREAT
    print("start BEFORE")
    play_frames(start_frame_before, end_frame)
    time.sleep(0.5)
    print("start AFTER")
    play_frames(start_frame_after, end_frame)
    time.sleep(0.5)

    # what about end frame? before/after?
    print("end BEFORE")
    play_frames(start_frame, end_frame_before)
    time.sleep(0.5)

    print("end AFTER")
    play_frames(start_frame, end_frame_after)
    time.sleep(0.5)

time.sleep(0.5)
